segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool reaching for the cookie jar, and he looks like he’s about to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is wobbling, and his balance is terrible.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe he’s standing on that thing to get cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for him to hand her one.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t seem to care that he’s about to topple over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman even knows they’re doing this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s so distracted by the dishes that she hasn’t noticed anything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should step in before the boy hurts himself.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then again, maybe he’ll be fine—kids are surprisingly resilient.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just hope he doesn’t pull the whole cabinet down with him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is such a chaotic little scene, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR
